original:
Exemption from resuscitation efforts typically occurs when a patient has an advance directive, a Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment (POLST) form indicating that resuscitation is not desired, or a valid Do Not Attempt Resuscitation (DNAR) order.


End-of-life care is focused on providing support during the natural progression of life, particularly when curative treatments are no longer viable. According to the National Hospic
